New Records: Glenn Maxwell clubbed the fastest Twenty20 international century on Australian soil, reaching his century from just 50 balls.
Maxwell equalled Indian great Rohit Sharma with the most T20I centuries — five.
Australia's total of 4-241 was the nation's fourth-highest in a T20I.
Key Match Events: Glenn Maxwell scored an unbeaten 120 from 55 balls, featuring eight sixes and 12 fours.
Marcus Stoinis of Australia ran out Jason Holder of the West Indies to take the final wicket and win the match.
Marcus Stoinis claimed 3-36 in the match.
Captain Rovman Powell top-scored for the West Indies with 63 from 36 balls.
Andre Russell contributed 37 from 16 balls for the West Indies.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell expressed his satisfaction with his performance, emphasizing the importance of making the most of the opportunity when the ball is not doing too much.
Maxwell highlighted his reliance on hand speed to get out of trouble if his footwork is slow.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Left-arm quick Spencer Johnson replaced Sean Abbott, who was ruled out of the series finale due to a shoulder injury.
